column4: quick question, should I use a hub or switch to connect additional computers to my adsl router?
both will work
what is the difference?
ah
the switch will only send the packets to the destination computer
the hub will send the packets to all hosts
how do I go about connecting peripherals to a network?
you mean devices with an ethernet conection or sharing devices connected to a computer?
ethernet
if you have a dhcp server, just plug
just an appropriate cable required then?
straight ethernet cable will work always
also, some switches support crossed ethernet
surely the peripheral requires an ethernet port
of course, you need an ethernet port in the switch for each peripheral
my printer has a usb port, what do I need to connect it to a hub/switch,
you can't connect it. you connect it the printer to a computer and then share it through networking
I want to be able to share peripherals without the host computer being on, is it poss?
i don't think so. if your printer hasn't got ethernet, you'll need a computer (or another device working as a computer)
: or a switch with usb port
don't think that it exists, and if it does it would be for ethernet over usb, not managing a printer over usb
printers without ethernet lack a printer server and most also lack postscript interpretation, so they need a computer managing them
: nevermind, I'll have to make do then
